text:
The COVID-19 pandemic was confirmed to have spread to Panama on 9 March 2020.
Cases.
, Panama reported 2528 cases, 63 deaths and 16 recoveries. One of the dead was a 64-year-old male, who also suffered from diabetes and pneumonia.
Of those infected, 83 were sent to a hospital. The infected individuals belong to the 29-59 age group and had each recently traveled abroad.
A 13-year-old girl died of Covid-19 on 23 March.
Response.
The government declared a state of emergency on 13 March 2020. The move frees US$50 million for a period of 180 days to purchase goods and services to combat COVID-19.
